alert.note: Alert for Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:06PM EST until January 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 PM EST, The Mahwah River at Suffern observed a stage of 5.17 ft. This is minor flood stage. The water level will continue to recede through this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Stony Brook, Ramapo River, Saddle River, Fyke Brook, Mahwah River, Torne Brook, Masonicus Brook, and Pompton River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
